topic.title: Installing as non-root, non-sudo
topic.shortdesc: Installing on Mac OS X as non-root, non-sudo is for development purposes only.

section.p: There may be cases when you want to install the server as a non-root, non-sudo user. If you perform a non-sudo, non-root installation, you can run Couchbase Server and all Couchbase command-line tools.

ol.li:
After downloading Couchbase Server, open Terminal and go to the Downloads directory:
cd ~/Downloads/

Unzip the package containing Couchbase Server:
open couchbase-server-enterprise_x86_64_2.1.0.zip

Move Couchbase App to your /Applications folder:
mv couchbase-server-enterprise_x86_64_2.1.0/Couchbase\ Server.app /Applications/

Start the server from Terminal:
open /Applications/Couchbase\ Server.app
This enables you to use Couchbase Server as a non-sudo, non-root user.
To stop the server, click on the Couchbase icon in the menu bar and select Quit Couchbase Server.
